intro: Mesembryanthemum montis-draconis, commonly known as the Dragon's Mountain ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, demonstrating remarkable drought tolerance. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow, white, and pink, often appearing in spring. Mesembryanthemum montis-draconis is well adapted to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
